column4: can a package be removed without removing it's dependancies? :P
sure, actually that's the default behavior
it does if you do "sudo apt-get autoremove gearman", but not with just "remove"
you mean autoremove removes the dependancies while remove does not ?
more or less. autoremove removes packages that are unneeded (i.e. not depended upon by any other package), so if your package was the only one that depended on them, they get removed
and remove would just remove the package but not the ones on which it's dependant?
yes (although you can do "sudo apt-get autoremove" later)

although i have to ask, why do you want to keep dependencies installed if nothing is dependant on them? if it's because you have manually compiled stuff that APT doesn't know about, there's probably a better way
so how do you want me to delete a pakcage ?
I thought sudo apt-get remove gearman would delete gearman and all it's dependancies, but you said autoremove will do that
both are correct, but i would use "autoremove", because, why keep the dependencies installed if they're no longer needed?
ok, I will use autoremove from now onwards :)
you can also use "remove" and then just do a "sudo apt-get autoremove" periodically, to get rid of unneeded things. matter of preference.
so sudo apt-get autoremove removes ALL the unneeded dependancies/packages ?
